review_content: Light fake lemon like you taste in a Sprite or something. Hazy golden pour with fizzy head. Light sweet end. Can from Thailand somewhere.
Pours yellow with a thick white head and heavy carbonation. Aroma of lemonade. Taste has very sweet lemonade and a slight bitter note. Palate has a barely detectable element of beer. Very soda-like.
Kolor cytrusowy, klarowne, piana szybko znika. Aromat metaliczny, trochę cytrusowy, w smaku metaliczne, sacharyna, czuć sztuczność tego piwa, nie polecam.

Canned, from random 7-Eleven, Singapore  Hazy yellow, coarse head. Aroma of lemonade and jam. Sweet with light body and clean mouthfeel. Sticky and artificlal, syrupy finish wioth some saccharine. Very low drinkability.
500ml can. Pours cloudy white yellow. Lemon, a real lemon curd type thing. Not much beer left. Looks, tastes and smells like quite a nice lager shandy. Fine by me.

(Can) Pours hazy amber with thin white head. Refreshing pleasant lemon aroma. Light body and fizzy. Taste is sweet and tangy and refreshing. Well, it's not a beer and judging it as one would result in a much lower score, but it's clearly sold as a low alcohol refreshing radler, and it's quite respectable in that category. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This is a caught in between kind of product, not as shandy as other shandy, at the same time, not as beer as other beer (if it is a beer at all).
Can from 7 eleven. Medium head with medium duration. Color is hazy yellow. Aroma and taste are artificial lemon, malt and was actually quite nice to drink in the hot Singapore climate.
Can - Candied lemon peel. Cleriah yellow gold with a small white head. Sweet and light lemon with a bit of a sweet malty finish.

On the hot streets of Singapore with Audrie and Marissa, ducked into a Seven Eleven to quench my dry palate ! Went with this radler which tasted like lemonade...it was right out of the can, sweet lemony with no noticeable alcohol ! Quenched my thirst ! Quaff Score 3 / 10
Tried at a tasting in Sai Kung. Not especially noteworthy but nice and refreshing if you want a Radler. Very drinkable at 2%. Carbonation is not too aggressive, which I like.
Free sample in Sai Kung en route to furniture shopping. Hazy light green-yellow pour. Foamy white head. Artificial lemon aroma. Taste follows. Not bad at all.

500 ml can bought at 7-Eleven on Lock Road, Tsim Sha Tsui.



Cloudy hazy pale golden pear juice colour; Half finger head with soapy white foam which fades in 30 seconds; Fair sticky lacing with active slight carbonation; Fairly fragrant and very sweet aroma of lemon soda, lemonade and sugar; Close to strong sweet taste of lemon soda, lemon juice, strong carbo, very light malt and sugar; Mid to light body, thick and slick palate; Mouth feel is all lemon soda in a very thick background. Sweet and lemony and some light shades of malt. Heavy, strongly carbo yet not cloying. No hop smell and taste whatsoever. Iffy… Wet after taste. Sweet and very easy to mouth.



Comments: This one is almost overwhelmingly a lemon soda with a wortyTiger Beer base which contributes to its thick and heavy feel. No hops, not even hint of shandy taste, but at least it is free of Tiger Beer’s adjunct rice and cloyness. Good for being a pop, but no good as a Radler. Once is enough.

Sticky lemonade beginning. Fresh sugary without too much beer. Sweetish lemonade aftertaste. 
Nice lemonade, but not really beery.

Can at a Penang hawker center. Hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of lemonade and lemon juice. Flavour is light moderate sweet and a touch sour. Light bodied with high carbonation. Not a bad radler.
Light fake lemon like you taste in a Sprite or something. Hazy golden pour with fizzy head. Light sweet end. Can from Thailand somewhere.
Pours yellow with a thick white head and heavy carbonation. Aroma of lemonade. Taste has very sweet lemonade and a slight bitter note. Palate has a barely detectable element of beer. Very soda-like.
Kolor cytrusowy, klarowne, piana szybko znika. Aromat metaliczny, trochę cytrusowy, w smaku metaliczne, sacharyna, czuć sztuczność tego piwa, nie polecam.

Canned, from random 7-Eleven, Singapore  Hazy yellow, coarse head. Aroma of lemonade and jam. Sweet with light body and clean mouthfeel. Sticky and artificlal, syrupy finish wioth some saccharine. Very low drinkability.
500ml can. Pours cloudy white yellow. Lemon, a real lemon curd type thing. Not much beer left. Looks, tastes and smells like quite a nice lager shandy. Fine by me.

(Can) Pours hazy amber with thin white head. Refreshing pleasant lemon aroma. Light body and fizzy. Taste is sweet and tangy and refreshing. Well, it's not a beer and judging it as one would result in a much lower score, but it's clearly sold as a low alcohol…
This is a caught in between kind of product, not as shandy as other shandy, at the same time, not as beer as other beer (if it is a beer at all).
